poem:
Transience of Rapture

In synthetic glow, the plastic
strings hum, mimicking life;
we dance, ephemeral heroes
to a fleeting pulse. An era
encased in buttons, now dissolved
in silence. Yet the echoes
linger, ghosts of joy, shadows
of movement past the fevered night.
